title: Cleavages and party sytems in Russia and China

content.prompt: The nature of the social and political cleavages in China and Russia are different because in China

choices.label: there are no significant ethnic cleavages or conflicts, while in Russia ethnicity is a central cleavage
regional differences have not led to secessionist movements, while in Russia this is a major source of upheaval
the government has managed to maintain the gap between rich and poor close to premarket reform levels, while in Russia inequality has grown enormously
the Communist Party is still one important and stable channel of upward mobility, while in Russia it is not
there is no system of public education after primary school, while in Russia education is free through the university level for anyone who can pass the tests

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
